Change has been successfully merged
Woohoo!

To convert pldmd to use transport APIs, we should start with using tid in handler https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/2b85d7844c6a0731a25fa103aebd5f5d53475500/requester/handler.hpp#L39 and requester code https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/2b85d7844c6a0731a25fa103aebd5f5d53475500/requester/request.hpp#L154
without this changing we will be mess-up between TID and EID.
The idea is change all of code use EID to TID, in PLDM repo we should only concern about TID.

Ideally yes we want to be using the TID, but where do we get the TID from to use?

The `pldm_transport` APIs expect a TID as this is what we should be using as per the spec, however the pldm code is not yet in the right place to use the actual TID. So for the `pldm_transport` APIs we are using the EID as the TID.

I didn't want to start using the variable `tid` in pldmd (except for setting up the transport) if we don't actually have a mechanism yet to get the actual TID. This way we are under no illusions that we have the TID and it is clear that we are still using the EID.

It's a bit clunky, but we are just moving piece by piece towards fixing up pldm/libpldm to have a logical separation of concepts :)

There are two options for TID:

1. You can include static TID equivalent with the configured EID in the configuration file.
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/2b85d7844c6a0731a25fa103aebd5f5d53475500/pldmd/pldmd.cpp#L227

2. Get the TID from the terminus in discovery phase.

3. Use static TID.
This is great workaround to have the TID for pldm_transport_mctp_demux_map_tid().
Hmmm. I didn't even think of this. We should put this in libpldm in `pldm_transport_mctp_demux_init()` before we get any further with exploiting the new transport API.
It's already in `pldm_transport_mctp_demux_open()` so we can get rid of this.
I think this should be converted to `pldm_transport_recv_msg()`?
Yeah we can do that if we make the transport APIs not requester specific. https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/63841
Done

I do wonder if we can get away without this check. It should never fail.

Also we've never validated if `peekedLength > 1`, only that `peekedLength > 0` 😞
This should probably go in the specific transport implementations
Done

This should be `pldm_transport_send_msg()`?

By refactoring the `sendmsg()` and `recv()` (asymmetry?) parts to be in terms of `pldm_transport_*` APIs we shouldn't need the fd any more either?
It should be the same for this code. https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/requester/request.hpp#L199
We could do that, or we could use `pldm_transport_send_msg` after https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/63841 is merged.
Done
Why do we still need the fd if we're passing in a `pldm_transport&`?
Because of below, and the handler makes requests.
Done
Why do we still need the fd if we're passing in a `pldm_transport&`?

We need the fd to resize the send buf of the socket if the message is bigger than the send buf. 

We can only get the fd from `struct pldm_transport_mctp_demux` via `pldm_transport_mctp_demux_init_pollfd` but atm we're passing around the generic  `struct pldm_transport`. We currently don't have a mechanism to get from the generic to the specific struct.

What makes more sense though is for the resizing of the socket sendbuf to be in libpldm, which I'm slowly slowly working on (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/63842).
Done

Okay, CI has now hit this:

```
/usr/bin/ld: libpldmresponder/libpldmresponder.so.0.1.p/base.cpp.o: in function `pldm::requester::Request::send() const':
/data0/jenkins/workspace/ci-repository/openbmc/pldm/build/../requester/request.hpp:189:(.text._ZNK4pldm9requester7Request4sendEv[_ZNK4pldm9requester7Request4sendEv]+0x5b): undefined reference to `pldm_transport_send_msg'
```

which means so long as the code works, the next step is to stabilise the `pldm_transport_*()` APIs in libpldm.
These headers should use system includes, not local includes.
Done
The patch set LGTM.
Let me just audit whether there are further uses of the requester APIs that need to be converted. I think the softoff application needs conversion too, for instance.
This code is handling the PLDM message to BMC right? Do we have any reason to remove it?

it's using the TransportImpl type below. Delphine/Bonnie's patch just copy/pasted the implementation in pldmd/pldmd.cpp. I've instead put that in common/transport.[ch]pp and referenced it here and in pldmd/pldmd.cpp

Hi Thu Nguyen,
Did you got any error message? We would need that for further investigation.

> Hi Thu Nguyen,
> Did you got any error message? We would need that for further investigation.

The error messages:
```
# pldmtool base GetPLDMVersion -m 8 -t 0 -v
pldmtool: Tx: 85 00 03 00 00 00 00 01 00
pldmtool: Rx: 85 00 03 00 00 00 00 01 00
Response Message Error: rc=3,cc=0
# pldmtool base GetPLDMTypes -m 8 -v
pldmtool: Tx: 86 00 04
pldmtool: Rx: 86 00 04
Response Message Error: rc=0,cc=2
# pldmtool base GetPLDMTypes -m 8 -v
pldmtool: Tx: 8b 00 04
pldmtool: Rx: 8b 00 04
Response Message Error: rc=3,cc=0
```
But as my investigate, it seem the issue come from libpldmresponder but not from the patch set.
Moreover, the error only happens when we access the BMC EID which does not usually use by end user. Let continue with this patch set and back to issue with libpldmresponder later.
@Thu: Can you reproduce the problem if you revert this patch?
Should be `return pldm_transport_send_msg(transport, tid, tx, len);`
Done
Verify the patch set v#24 with Ampere system.
LGTM.
would prefer nullptr rather than NULL - as its cpp code.

this is also present in line nu:79, we need to remove that.
Done
I dont see this being used anywhere in the code, if we dont need this ,then we dont need to set it in config.h ?
It's used in the libpldm headers to work out whether to expose the poll-based functionality.
Ack

rather than setting it in config.h , can we add it dynamically ?

```
if(get_option('transport-implementation')) == 'mctp-demux'
   add_project_arguments('-DPLDM_TRANSPORT_WITH_MCTP_DEMUX', language : 'cpp')
else
   add_project_arguments('-DPLDM_TRANSPORT_WITH_AF_MCTP', language: 'cpp')
endif
```

and in the code we could just check 

`#ifdef PLDM_TRANSPORT_WITH_MCTP_DEMUX` & `#ifdef PLDM_TRANSPORT_WITH_AF_MCTP`
Why though? This has the same effect. Line 77 forces the inclusion of `config.h` for all translation units.

Although this has the same effect,I think i have some residual memories from working on bmcweb days... where we felt going away from config.h is better(where ever we can) , as that would help us to have changes that does not touch multiple files(inclusion of config.h). Having this dynamically added via compiler arguments gives that flexibility right ? happy to be corrected if you think otherwise ?

But as-is i at the moment - we dont have much effect as we are already including config.h at multiple places for other stuff.
Realised from https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/67155, that we have a better way to include config.h, so this concern has been resolved.
do we wanna enforce a `default value` here itself ? so that subproject based build wouldn't need additional override while building the daemon ?

the default is the first choice:

> A combo allows any one of the values in the choices parameter to be selected. If no default value is set then the first value will be the default.

https://mesonbuild.com/Build-options.html#combos
Ack, thanks for the info. Was not aware of this.

how are we planning to dynamically change the send buffer size ? do we need some sort of libpldm API to be able to do that ?

There were certain OEM FILE IO commands which needed us to increase the send buffer size in the past.

This is already handled in libpldm:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/src/transport/socket.c#L53-L75
Sweet!,Ack.
pldm has migrated to lg2 based logging , please modify this to use lg2.
Done
lg2 based logging.
Done
same here as well .
Done
